entry.def: If you describe a person or their behaviour as unbending, you mean that they have very strict beliefs and attitudes, which they are unwilling to change.

example.ex: ...her unbending opposition to the old regime.
example.tran: 她对旧政权不屈不挠的反对

means.word_mean: 1. incapable of adapting or changing to meet circumstances;

auth_sentence.content: He doesn't bring unbending Orwellian principles to a debate.
auth_sentence.res_content: He doesn't bring unbending Orwellian principles to a debate.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He doesn't bring unbending Orwellian principles to a debate.

auth_sentence.content: There has never been one true unbending Catholic observance, even if each iteration makes a claim to be the truth.
auth_sentence.res_content: There has never been one true unbending Catholic observance, even if each iteration makes a claim to be the truth.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There has never been one true unbending Catholic observance, even if each iteration makes a claim to be the truth.

auth_sentence.content: His Prophet flirted with compromise, then rejected it, and his unbending idea grew strong enough to bend history to its will.
auth_sentence.res_content: His Prophet flirted with compromise, then rejected it, and his unbending idea grew strong enough to bend history to its will.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His Prophet flirted with compromise, then rejected it, and his unbending idea grew strong enough to bend history to its will.

means.word_mean: 顽固的;坚定的;不妥协的
